00013 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00014 {
00015         int iReturn = 0;
00016         int iOp1, iOp2;
00017         unsigned char cFunc;
00018         int iResult;
00019         
00020         // introduce yourself...
00021         printf("VSLab client, version %s, build %s %s\n", VSLC_VERSION, __DATE__, __TIME__);
00022 
00023         // check command line parameters
00024         if (argc < 5) {
00025                 printf("Missing arguments!\n");
00026                 printf("Usage: vslabc op1 op2 func ip\n");
00027                 printf("Operands op1 and op2 must be integers.\n");
00028                 printf("func = m -> Multiplication\n");
00029                 printf("func = d -> Division\n");
00030                 printf("ip = IP address of VSLab server\n");
00031                 return -1;
00032         }
00033 
00034         // convert command line parameters to integers
00035         iOp1 = atoi(argv[1]);
00036         iOp2 = atoi(argv[2]);
00037 
00038         cFunc = argv[3][0];
00039 
00040         // set target IP
00041         vslcl_SetUnicastAddress(argv[4]);
00042         // initialize vslab client library
00043         vslcl_Open();
00044 
00045         // call function
00046         switch (cFunc) {
00047                 case 'm': iReturn = vslcl_Multiply(iOp1, iOp2, &iResult); break; 
00048                 case 'd': iReturn = vslcl_Divide(iOp1, iOp2, &iResult); break;
00049                 default: printf("Function not defined!\n"); vslcl_Close(); return -1;
00050         }
00051 
00052         // evaluate return value
00053         if( iReturn < 0 ) 
00054         {
00055                 printf("VSLab client: Got an error: %d\n", iReturn);
00056         }
00057         else {
00058                 printf("VSLab client: Result: %d\n", iResult);
00059         }
00060 
00061         // close library
00062         vslcl_Close();
00063 
00064         return 0;
00065 }
